CONTACT DADE CITY GUN CLUB
Please note: We currently do not publish a phone number as the phone is not monitored during the day.
Please use the form below to contact the club.
Name
*
First Name
Last Name
I am a:
DCGC Member
Non-Member
Phone
*
(###)
###
####
Email
*
Subject
*
Message
*
Thank you for contacting Dade City Gun Club.
We will reply back to you as soon as possible.
Clicking “SUBMIT” will send your inquiry to the Secretary of the Board of Directors
Physical Address:
35445 County Road 52
Dade City, FL 33525
Mailing Address:
PO BOX 1861
Dade City, FL 33526
Directions:
NOTE: Due to recent roadway changes, street signs are not correct and Google Maps
currently  DOES NOT direct you to the correct location.
From I-75, take exit  285 (SR 52, Dade City/San Antonio) East 5.4 miles,
Take a left on Prospect Rd., then a right on CR 52 Alt, 1/2 mile on the left
From Dade City, take County Road 52 West 3.4 miles
Look for our sign on the North side of County Road 52 Alt.
Hours:
Open 6 days a week
Closed Thursdays, Easter and Christmas Day

Open 6 Days a Week
8am - 4pm
Closed Thursdays for maintenance
Closed Easter and Christmas
Range Safety Officers
Physical Address:
35445 County Road 52
Dade City, FL 33525
Mailing Address:
PO Box 1861
Dade City, FL 33526

Become a Dade City Gun Club Member
Membership Has It’s Privileges
Membership provides you the privilege of shooting at the range without paying range fees during regular operating hours
Your membership is a family membership.  It includes your spouse and any of your children under 18 years of age to shoot without paying range fees.  Each family member will now be issued a membership card that must be shown to the Range Safety Officers on duty when you come to shoot.  Of course your spouse can shoot anytime by merely showing her card.  However, youth shooters must me under the direct supervision of a member at all times while on the range.
Your membership allows ONLY the named member to vote in club elections.
Credit Cards now accepted for
range and membership fees.
Dade City Gun Club Membership
$300 ($301 w/credit card) for the first year including $150 application fee.
Initial membership application must be completed and paid on the range
$150 ($151 w/credit card) annual renewal
Cash, checks and credit cards accepted
NO REFUNDS OF MEMBERSHIP FEES or APPLICATION FEES
html
Membership Renewal
Membership Renewal
Please enter your membership expiration date to proceed with your renewal.
Membership Expiration Date:
Check Renewal Status
For more information on Dade City Gun Club Membership, fill out the form below or see any range safety officer on your next visit to the range.

*

We will get back to you as soon as possible.

Hours
Open 6 Days a Week
8am - 4pm
Closed Thursdays for maintenance
Closed Easter and Christmas
Range Safety Officers
Physical Address:
35445 County Road 52
Dade City, FL 33525
Mailing Address:
PO Box 1861
Dade City, FL 33526

Competitive Matches
DADE CITY WEATHER
We cannot predict the weather or range conditions on match days.
If you think the match may be canceled please call Rob Stansberry at 804-314-2604 after 8 am the day of the match.
Any matches scheduled for the first Saturday of the month that are cancelled will be held on the following Saturday
Dade City Gun Club hosts competitive matches on the first Saturday of each month.
Matches include, but not limited to: (Click each event for more details)
Rimfire Steel Match
The pistol and rifle matches have the same course of fire. The pistol match is fired from the 10 yard line and the Rifle match is fired from the 25 yard line.
Equipment:
Rim fire handgun or rifle with any type of sights. No air guns or shot shells. Holsters are not used.
Any appropriate Rim fire Solid or Hollow Point 22 ammunition – No Shot Shells allowed.
Concealed Carry Match
The CCM is a draw from the holster match. The CCM is a "friendly" type of target shooting and is a great way to compete and hone your skills of draw from the holster and sight alignment.
Equipment:
Center Fire Revolver or Semi-Auto Pistol.
60 Rounds of ammunition
Side Carry Holster Only - NO Back, Cross-draw or Shoulder rigs permitted.
Revolver shooters must have 3 speed loaders with appropriate holders/pouches
Semi-Auto shooters must have 4 magazines with appropriate pouches.
Scoring utensils – Pen or Pencil plus chalk or target pasters.
Target:
B-27 "Reduced" targets will be provided.
Course of Fire:
60 Rounds Total
Stage #1
3 yards - 10 shots – 2 five shot strings - within 18 seconds – 2 in the head - 3 center mass. Score and total target.
Stage #2
7 yards - 10 shots – 2 five shot strings - within 24 seconds all center mass. Score and total target.
Stage #3
10 yards - 10 shots – 2 five shot strings - within 30 seconds all center mass. Score and total target.
Replace target, and repeat stages 1 thru 3.
Scoring:
Scoring is 10 points per round - Stages 1 through 3 has a possible 300 points and is fired 2 times for a match total of 600 possible points.
3 Target Silhouette Match
The Three Target Silhouette Match is a quick paced match fired at three different distances with Revolvers or Semi Auto Pistols.
This match is a great way to hone your strong side – weak side and holster draw skills.
Equipment:
Center Fire Revolver or Semi-Auto Pistol.
Side Carry Holster Only - NO Back, Crossdraw or Shoulder rigs permitted.
Revolver shooters must have 3 speedloaders with appropriate holders/pouches
Semi-Auto shooters must have three magazines with appropriate pouches.
Scoring utensils
– Pen or Pencil plus chalk or target pasters.
Ammunition:
54 Rounds of ammunition preferably light to mid-load.
Targets:
Three B-34 targets will be provided.
Course of Fire
Round 1
Stage 1
10 yards - 6 shots – two handed within 12 seconds – 2 shots at each of three targets.
Shooter immediately reloads and moves to the seven yard line
Stage 2
7 yards - 6 shots – one hand Strong side within 10 seconds – 2 shots at each of three targets.
Shooter immediately reloads and moves to the five yard line
Stage 3
5 yards - 6 shots – one hand Weak side within 10 seconds – 2 shots at each of three targets.
Shooter unloads and holsters an empty firearm
Round 2
Repeat stages 1 through 3 Round 3
Ten, Seven and Five Yards.- 18 rounds – three six round shot strings fired consecutively.
Scoring:
Scoring is 10 points per shot – Maximum score is 540 points minus Round 3 time.
Round 1 and 2 each have a possible 180 points and is fired 2 times for a total of 360 points.
Round 3 is scored and timed, and has a possible 180 points.
Time is the total time to fire the 18 rounds in Round 3.
Scoring for the Match will be the totals for Rounds 1 & 2 and the score for Round 3 minus the time.
Bullseye Match
The Bullseye Match is held on the first Sunday of each month
Course of Fire:
Stage 1
Slow fire - 10 shots in 10 minutes @50 yards
Stage 2
Timed fire - 5 shots in 20 seconds - 2 strings @ 25 yards same target size
Stage 3
Rapid fire - 5 shots in 10 seconds - 2 strings @ 25 yads same target size
That’s 30 rounds total
We go through above 3 times for a total of 90 rounds
To simplify and explain - I run the slow fire 3 times which completes the slow fire stage, then I run the Timed Fire stage 3 times to complete the Timed Fire stage, Then I run the Rapid Fire stage 3 times to complete the Rapid Fire stage and the entire Bullseye event is complete @ a total of 90 rounds
Match Fees:
Club Members
5.00 per match per person
Non-Club Members
$5.00 per match per person
Daily range fee per person which includes full use of the public range after the match
Check the
Event Calendar
for upcoming dates and match start times

DADE CITY GUN CLUB
BOARD OF DIRECTORS
Club Board Meetings take place on the 2nd Tuesday of every month starting at 10:00 am in the clubhouse.
Only Club Members may attend Board meetings. If you have a suggestion or topic you would like to see discussed contact the Board using the form below to have it added to the agenda. This message will be sent to the DCGC Secretary
Name

Phone

We will respond as soon as possible.
